jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.description:
We’re an ambitious, friendly team attempting to solve the biggest problem facing small businesses - cashflow.

We’re using machine learning to provide real-time forecasting that helps small businesses and their accountants to be more confident in their decisions.

We’re now looking for a DevOps Engineer to help us set the tone for DevOps at Fluidly, working with with the wider team to help us scale the platform.

Quote from our CTO (https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.linkedin.com%2Fin%2Fmichael-hancock-6790a32%2F) “Infrastructure as code is a must, we work in a compliant environment so experience of at least one regime is required. DevOps to me is a specialisation within the dev team, someone who helps and guides developers to deliver and support their own features in production, so I'm looking for someone who shares that vision. Security is a must, but they will need to implement it pragmatically, and not hamper the speed of delivery, so they must be delivery focused.”

Where you can have impact

* This is a green field project, you’ll be owning everything DevOps at Fluidly for the long term and be making decisions that impact our short and long term growth.
* DevOps culture! You're not a dumping ground for anything vaguely infrastructure related. You are here to solve the mind bendingly difficult problems of scaling and help engineers to self serve.
* The infrastructure is largely for you to define, we will need to set up multi-region to support the US market, whilst ensuring that we are compliant and minimal maintenance overhead.
* We do continuous deployment, so there's no staging environment! Madness I hear you cry, well actually no, but it does require a high bar when it comes to TDD, CI/CD, monitoring and automated rollback. You will help us succeed in these key areas.

Requirements

Who you are

Skills:

* You have some great experience of production public cloud environments and their nuances and intricacies.
* Infrastructure as code, nothing else will do.
* You will be experienced leading the DevOps culture within a development team. You will help the developers self-serve, not just be a dumping ground for everything DevOps.
* Experience with YML based CI/CD pipelines (we use CircleCI).
* Experience of kubernetes and associated technologies.
* You will have worked in an environment with 99.99+% up-time - and you will understand a meaningful measurement of that statistic
* A good, pragmatic understanding of security.
* Bonus Points for:
** Working under FCA or PCI compliance regimes
** Supporting BIG data pipelines in GCP

Knowledge:

* You’re ideally product focused and understand the balance between speed of delivery and quality.
* If you have experienced scaling a system / team that’s also great, we would love people who have built up experience in this area.
* You’ve failed at things before. You’ve seen it, lived it and learnt from it and can help us identify potential pitfalls.

Behaviours:

* You ain't gonna need it (YAGNI).
* You’re a great communicator and want to understand the commercial impact and play nicely with product.
* You know when to be decisive and when to ensure decisions are made quickly and efficiently.
* You have strong opinions weakly held - you can defend a position, but give it up easily when consensus is against you even if you're right.
* You’re humble, no room for brilliant jerks

Benefits

More on us

We strive to create an inclusive workplace where people have the opportunity to succeed, regardless of gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital or civil partner status, race, religion or belief, disability, age or pregnancy.

We embrace difference and know that if you can be yourself at work, you'll be happier, more motivated and creative. We want you to bring your whole self to work, to have your own perspective and know that you belong.

Benefits

* Your choice of the best kit money can buy. Even that absurdly priced escape-key-less macbook. If you want it.
* The most competitive salary we can afford (DOE)
* Meaningful equity. We want people to have a serious stake in the business so that all of our interests are aligned. It’s your baby too.
* 25 days holiday – and we will make you take it. Burnout is not big or clever.
* Limitless challenge and scope for development. You are joining us at a very exciting time and have the opportunity to take this role in your preferred direction as we grow.
* As much of our time as you need. You professional growth is important to us, and we want to help you to be awesome.
* Sensible problems that will add real value to real people. This isn’t a HBO parody company.
* Flexible working where possible. We like being in the office because it should be fun. All the same if you need to leave early on ${DAY} to make the school run, that’s no problem.

jobs.title: Frontend Engineer
jobs.description:
We’re a small, friendly team of 35, attempting to solve the biggest problem facing small businesses - cashflow.

We’re using engineering and machine learning to provide real-time forecasting that really helps small businesses and their accountants to be more confident in their decisions, and allow business owners to sleep a little better at night! We recently got recognised for our hard work by making into Wired’s top 10 European startups.

We’re now looking for a collaborative and humble Frontend Engineer to help us focus on scaling out the product as we bring on more users, working with some amazing engineers and data scientists to make that happen.

Where you can have impact

* Help solve the challenges of user engagement by building simple, intuitive UIs, experimenting quickly and cheaply and gathering direct feedback. You'll collaborate closely with product and UX to make this happen.
* Define and deliver features in a rapidly evolving market. We're defining a new category, so we don't know all the questions, let alone the answers. Your input is essential.
* Decide how build the next version of the web application: currently we're full stack javascript (React + Node). There are a lot of decisions to be made as we scale, so experience going through those changes would be ideal.
* Global expansion - we are scaling rapidly in the UK, the next step is to open in other markets, we'll need help building an app that works across continents.
* Continuous deployment - every commit goes directly to production, so you will have an extremely fast feedback cycle, but this also requires a very high bar in quality. Prior experience in this type of environment would be ideal.

Requirements

Who you are

Skills:

* You’re comfortable working across the stack, but particularly using core javascript, with and without frameworks. We use React and Express, and although it would be great to see people with experience using these in production, please do not rule yourself out if you haven’t.
* You’re comfortable with core programming and software development, and might have used React & Node.js in production before.
* You’re interested in automating repetitive tasks.
* You are customer centric and work well with product owners.

You’re comfortable working with some (does not need to be all) of the following:

* Node.js
* React.js
* Reduct
* Express
* Ava test runner
* Kubernetes
* ES6 with Babel via Webpack
* MongoDB
* Postgres
* Docker
* Redis
* Git

Knowledge:

* You’re ideally product focused and understand the balance between speed of delivery and quality.
* If you have experienced scaling a system / team that’s also great, we would love people who have built up experience in this area.
* You’ve failed at things before. You’ve seen it, lived it and learnt from it and can help us identify potential pitfalls.
* You have an entrepreneurial streak, with some great examples of how you saw an opportunity and made it happen.

Behaviours:

* You ain't gonna need it (YAGNI).
* You’re a great communicator and want to understand the commercial impact and play nicely with product.
* You know when to be decisive and when to ensure decisions are made quickly and efficiently.
* You have strong opinions weakly held - you can defend a position, but give it up easily when consensus is against you even if you're right.
* You’re humble, no room for brilliant jerks
* You’re a strong team player, knows how to get others to work well together

Benefits

Fluidly is backed by leading UK and US technology investors and we have a diverse, top-tier team across the board, drawn from leading firms and universities.

jobs.title: Sales Development Representative
jobs.description:
We’re a small, friendly team of 20, attempting to solve the biggest problem facing small businesses - cashflow.

We’re using engineering and machine learning to provide real-time forecasting that really helps small businesses and their accountants to be more confident in their decisions, and allow business owners to sleep a little better at night! We recently got recognised for our hard work by making into Wired’s top 10 European startups.

We’re now looking for a driven and enthusiastic business developer to develop and qualify our pipeline opportunities. We’re a small, but friendly team and you’ll have a lot of opportunity to progress quickly in the role.

Where you can have impact

* You’ll be one of the first two SDRs in the business, so you can have an immediate impact on Fluidly’s growth and also input into the direction of the team.
* You’ll work closely with the Account Executives to hand off warm, developed leads and work with them to understand the needs.
* You’ll be a Fluidly ambassador at events.
* Develop and implement outreach strategies that you will formulate with our Sales leaders here - PS they’ll be on hand at all times to give you great training and the best start in your early SaaS career.

Requirements

Who you are

Skills:

* You’re an expert at finding the right person to speak to and working out how to get in touch. No gatekeeper is a match for you.
* You know how to dig to the heart of a customer’s needs quickly, getting their attention and making sure you can pitch Fluidly in a way that works for them.
* You’re super organised when it comes to lead management.

Knowledge:

* You’ve ideally been here before (although SaaS experience isn’t a necessity) and you’re confident selling into clients and our partner network.
* Familiarity with a CRM like pipedrive or Salesforce would be excellent. It doesn’t have to be one of those two, but experience with something is ideal.
* You’ve worked in a SaaS or software sales business before and you know the deal, so you are comfortable working with the Account Executives.
* You also know how to work with marketing teams and you’re interested in building a world class sales pipeline.

Behaviours:

* You’re a great communicator and you’re able to quickly make complex products easy to understand.
* You’re competitive and driven - you love the thrill of the chase and the plaudits for bringing in great new leads.
* You know when to be decisive and when to ensure decisions are made quickly and efficiently.
* You’re a friendly and calm person, able to play nicely with others - our people are our brand.
* You’re humble, no room for brilliant jerks.
* You’re a strong team player, knows how to get others to work well together.

Benefits

jobs.title: Senior Data Engineer
jobs.description:
We’re a small, friendly team of 35, attempting to solve the biggest problem facing small businesses - cashflow.

We’re using engineering and machine learning to provide real-time forecasting that really helps small businesses and their accountants to be more confident in their decisions, and allow business owners to sleep a little better at night! We recently got recognised for our hard work by making into Wired’s top 10 European startups.

We’re now looking for a collaborative and humble Senior Data Engineer to help us build a green field microservices backend, working with some amazing engineers and data scientists to make that happen.

Where you can have impact

* This is a green field microservice system - ideally you will have experience of building something like this before and be excited to start again from scratch and own the design / decisions.
* We are building a real-time, event driven architecture, so you will get to use modern ETL tools and cloud infrastructure. You will love eventual consistency.
* We have an ever increasing flow of data. We need to build data pipelines that work for 100x our current throughput and that's only to cover the next 12 months!
* We are growing fast, so building robust, secure and maintainable API to serve data is our top priority. You will know what that involves and have the battle scars to prove it.
* We’re big on DevOps, everyone owns their code to production and after, you will be a fan of IaC - we use Terraform.

Requirements

Skills:

* You have experience with deployment pipelines and continuous delivery on cloud platforms (we use Google Cloud Platform, Docker).
* You’re comfortable using Python / Java or Scala in production with an eye for quality and experience in data streaming (for real, not just the buzzword). We're pretty agnostic, but currently using Python a lot.
* You’re great at data modelling and data migrations.
* You are customer centric and work well with product owners.
* You’ve built up a good understanding of *nix command line including tools such as ssh and Git.
* Ideally you’ve created complex data processing pipelines in a production environment, ideally streaming on Google Cloud Platform with systems like BigQuery, Kafka, Beam, any other streaming platform.

Knowledge:

* You’re ideally product focused and understand the balance between speed of delivery and quality.
* If you have experienced scaling a system / team that’s also great, we would love people who have built up experience in this area.
* You’ve failed at things before. You’ve seen it, lived it and learnt from it and can help us identify potential pitfalls.
* You have an entrepreneurial streak, with some great examples of how you saw an opportunity and made it happen.

* You’re a strong team player, knows how to get others to work well together.

jobs.title: Product Manager
jobs.description:
We’re a small, friendly team of 35, attempting to solve the biggest problem facing small businesses - poor cashflow.

We’re using engineering and machine learning to provide real-time forecasting that really helps small businesses and their accountants to be more confident in their decisions, and allow the owners to sleep a little better at night! We recently got recognised for our hard work by making into Wired’s top 10 UK startups.

We’re looking for a Product Manager to help us build a Fintech product that solves a real problem which impacts many business owners around the world.

You’ll care deeply about our customer needs, be passionate about creating a great user experience and be looking for a role where you can build a category leading Fintech product.

Who you are

You have a strong track-record in product management, potentially working with a SaaS business (although not a problem if you don’t) and ideally with a passion for Fintech. You’ll therefore have a strong ability to speak to everyone from engineers to marketing, and keep on top of new developments in the field.

We’re a super small team right now (21 people) with some big ambitions, so you’ll be up for getting your hands dirty whilst learning from others.

Where you can have impact

- Working closely with engineering, design, sales and customer success teams to collect and prioritize product inputs.
- Conducting user interviews and market research.
- Drive Product features from conception to delivery.
- Define and track KPIs and metrics to measure results for new features.
- Aiding the management of the product roadmap, including pricing, new features, segmentation etc.

Requirements:

Skills

- You’ll be an excellent communicator, comfortable working with everyone from Data Scientists to Customer Success.
- You’ll be able to disseminate complex ideas into clear product specifications
- You’ll be an excellent planner, highly organised and able to create and deliver to realistic deadlines.
- You’ll be able to balance customer needs with the internal plans.

Knowledge

- You know how to best prioritise product requirements across the roadmap.
- You’ll know how to keep all the other plates spinning at the same time.
- You’ll know when to say ‘No’
- You’ll know which vanity metrics to avoid.

Behaviours

- You’re a positive person, focused on solving problems and with a bias to action (Done is better than perfect, we all make mistakes).
- You’re not a fan of drama. You like to stay calm both under pressure and on a daily basis.
- You’re a curious individual, keen to analyse any data available internally or externally before reaching a conclusion.
- You’re comfortable with ambiguity. Fluidly is a fast growing business where requirements can change rapidly.
